page.title: 09AMERSHAM MUSEUM
page.content: Mr.Corns,a member of the Amersham Society,(and a governor of our school) took us round a building in Amersham which will be the museum.It was built about 1450, probably the oldest house in Amersham.Much of the 15th century timber is still intact though it needs restoring.They need Â£100,000 to pay for the house and repairs. Now the collection is housed in a room in the British Legion hall which we also visited.They have many unusual things from people including farmer's smocks, lace-making pillows and bob- bins for making the famous Amersham lace, old farmer's and farrier's tools a 1893 typewriter,and old sewing machine,Victorian sewing sets. There was a list of 38 different vers- ions of 'Amersham'from documents from 1066 to 1665.
